greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest prime divisor of 4*n^2+1.
comment: If the map "x -> smallest odd prime divisor of n^2+1" is iterated, does it always terminate in the 2-cycle (5 <-> 13)? - _Zoran Sunic_, Oct 25 2017
reference: Richard Friedberg, An Adventurer's Guide to Number Theory, McGraw-Hill, NY, 1968.
Popular Computing (Calabasas, CA), Friedberg's Sequence, Vol. 5 (No. 46, Jan 1977), page PC46-2.
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Apr 19 2015
